sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"愉快，快乐，高兴"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: pleasure, delight, rapture, enjoyment, joy, fun
means: pleasure ： 最普通常用词，常指不表露出来的满意或喜悦情绪，也指强烈的愉快或兴奋感。
delight ： 指强烈的、活泼的、显而易见的快乐和高兴。
rapture ： 书面语用词，指极端的欣喜、大喜或狂喜。
enjoyment比pleasure, joy和delight的语气轻，但更着重行为或乐事的本身，而不是感情。
joy ： 语气弱于rapture，强于pleasure，多指情感充溢，喜形于色的强烈的欢乐情绪。
fun ： 普通用词，指任何能给予喜悦的娱乐，或指娱乐本身。

sentence.Network_en: He mixed business and pleasure in a perfect and dynamic way.
sentence.Network_cn: 他以互动的方式将工作和娱乐完美地结合起来。

sentence.Network_en: I enjoy pleasure as much as the next person.
It was a rare pleasure to see him in action.

jx.jx_en_mean: used in formal requests and descriptions
jx.jx_cn_mean: [用于正式请求和描写]有幸，荣幸

lj.lj_ls: 他问他能否有幸请她吃午饭。

jx.jx_en_mean: used as a polite reply to thanks
jx.jx_cn_mean: [用作对谢意的客气回答]愿意为您效劳

lj.lj_ly: they take a perverse pleasure in causing trouble.
lj.lj_ls: 他们以惹是生非为乐事，真是变态。

jx.jx_en_mean: what would you like? (used especially when offering someone a choice)
jx.jx_cn_mean: 你喜欢什么? （尤用于给别人提供选择时）

lj.lj_ls: “你喜欢什么? ”“来一杯卡普契诺咖啡。”。

jx.jx_en_mean: gladly (used to express polite agreement or acceptance)
jx.jx_cn_mean: [用于表达客气的赞同或接受]高兴地，很乐意

means.word_mean: 肉体享乐,沉于声色,淫荡

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French plaisir 'to please' (used as a noun). The second syllable was altered under the influence of abstract nouns ending in -ure, such as measure

entry.def: If something gives you pleasure, you get a feeling of happiness, satisfaction, or enjoyment from it.

example.ex: Watching sport gave him great pleasure...
example.tran: 观看体育比赛给他以极大的愉悦。
每个人都从吃中得到满足感。

entry.tran: （尤指工作、职责之外的）娱乐，消遣
entry.def: Pleasure is the activity of enjoying yourself, especially rather than working or doing what you have a duty to do.

example.ex: He mixed business and pleasure in a perfect and dynamic way...
example.tran: 他以互动的方式将工作和娱乐完美地结合起来。

entry.tran: 乐趣；乐事；给人愉快的事物
entry.def: A pleasure is an activity, experience or aspect of something that you find very enjoyable or satisfying.

example.ex: Watching TV is our only pleasure.
example.tran: 看电视是我们唯一的乐事。

example.ex: ...the pleasure of seeing a smiling face.
example.tran: 看到一张微笑的面孔的愉悦

entry.tran: 很高兴见到…/…莅临的荣幸
entry.def: If you meet someone for the first time, you can say, as a way of being polite, that it is a pleasure to meet them. You can also ask for the pleasure of someone's company as a polite and formal way of inviting them somewhere.

example.ex: 'A pleasure to meet you, sir,' he said...
example.tran: 他说：“先生，很高兴见到您。”

example.ex: Mr and Mrs James Stephens request the pleasure of your company at the marriage of their daughter Caroline Mary to Mr David Smith.
example.tran: 詹姆斯·斯蒂芬斯夫妇敬请您莅临小女卡罗琳·玛丽与戴维·史密斯先生的婚礼。

entry.tran: （受到感谢时的一种礼貌回答）别客气，不用谢，是我的荣幸
entry.def: You can say 'It's a pleasure ' or 'My pleasure ' as a polite way of replying to someone who has just thanked you for doing something.
You can say 'With pleasure ' as a polite way of saying that you are very willing to do something.

example.ex: 'Could you photocopy the advert and put it in the post to us?' — 'With pleasure John.'
example.tran: “你能把广告影印一下寄给我们吗？”——“当然可以，约翰。”

means.word_mean: 1. a fundamental feeling that is hard to define but that people desire to experience;
2. something or someone that provides pleasure; a source of happiness;

sentences.sentence: "he serves at the pleasure of the President"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 令人愉快的, 舒适的
stems_affixes.word_buile: pleas愉快,高兴+ant表形容词→adj.令人愉快的, 舒适的
pleas愉快,高兴+e→满足的,高兴的
pleas愉快,高兴+ed表形容词→adj.高兴的, 满足的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 愉快, 快乐, 乐事
stems_affixes.word_buile: pleas愉快,高兴+ure表名词→n.愉快, 快乐, 乐事
dis不+please[adj.满足的,高兴的 v.请]→v.使不快, 使[人]生气
pleas愉快,高兴+e→满足的,高兴的

sentences.en: His grandchildren afforded him his greatest pleasure in his old age.
sentences.cn: 他的孙子和孙女们在晚年的时候给了他最大的欢乐。

sentences.cn: 他到巴黎是办公事还是游玩去了?

sentences.cn: 这是我最高兴的事之一。

sentences.en: May I have the pleasure of the next dance with you?
sentences.cn: 你肯赏光跟我跳下一个舞吗?

sentences.en: He will do angthing to pleasure her.

sentences.cn: 和你在一起我感到高兴。

jushi.chinese: 他的孙子和孙女们在他晚年的时候给了他最大的欢乐。

jushi.english: He writes not only to make money but also for pleasure.
jushi.chinese: 他写作不仅是为了赚钱,也是为了消遣。

jushi.english: Pleasure has its sting in its tail.
